44 FIELDIANA: GEOLOGY, VOLUME 35 

Cyclonema bilix (Conrad, 1842) 

Referred specimens: two specimens UC 29418 
 Evans, 1926, p. 204 
 Thompson-Cornell, 1970, p. 240 
 Upper Ordovician, Maquoketa Formation. 

Along the banks of Aux Sables Creek about 2 miles west of Minooka, 
 Grundy County, Illinois. Collected by University of Chicago field 
 class. 

Cyclonema bilix var. fluctuatum (James, 1874) 
 See: Cyclonema fluctuata James, 1874 

Cyclonema bilix lata (Meek, 1873) 

See: Cyclonema fluctuata James, 1874 

Cyclonema cincinnatiense Miller, 1882 

Holotype: not designated, to be selected from two specimens UC 8872 
 Miller, 1882a, pp. 230-231, pi. 9, figs. 8a-8c 

= Cyclonema varicosum Hall, 1870 

Ulrich and Scofield, 1897, p. 1060 

Thompson-Cornell, 1970, pp. 253-255, pi. 33, fig. 22 
 Middle Ordovician, Cynthiana Formation. 
 Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky. Faber Collection. 

Cyclonema concinna Hall, 1876 

' 'Plastocotypes ' ': three casts UC 22 1 57 

Hall, 1876, pi. 12, figs. 38-40 

Hall, 1879, pp. 38-39, pi. 12, figs. 38-40 
 Upper Devonian, Cheipung Group. 

Nichols, Tioga County, New York. James Hall Collection. 
 Remarks: The depository of the original specimen is unknown. 

Cyclonema (Dyeria) costatum (James, 1872) 
 See: Cyrtolites costatus James, 1872 

Cyclonema fasciata Ball, 1928 nomen nudum 
 See: Cyclonema s^. 

Cyclonema fluctuata James, 1874 

Referred specimens: ("cotypes"): 29 specimens, UC 2453
